comments:
In trying to reuse the old 2.1 perf tests on emftest03.torolab.ibm.com, to get a
performance baseline based on Eclipse 3.2M3/EMF 2.2M3, I've discovered that
something has changed (perhaps in 3.2M3/2.2M3, perhaps earlier) to cause a wee
bit o' breakage with the perf tests. Here's the error:

     [java] !ENTRY org.eclipse.osgi 2005-11-14 14:59:11.969
     [java] !MESSAGE An error occurred while automatically activating bundle
org.eclipse.emf.test.performance (140).
     [java] !STACK 0
     [java] org.osgi.framework.BundleException: The activator
org.eclipse.emf.test.performance.EMFTestPerformancePlugin for bundle
org.eclipse.emf.test.performance is invalid
     [java]     at
org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.AbstractBundle.loadBundleActivator(AbstractBundle.java:140)
     [java]     at
org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.BundleContextImpl.start(BundleContextImpl.java:965)
     [java]     at
org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.BundleHost.startWorker(BundleHost.java:313)
     [java]     at
org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.AbstractBundle.start(AbstractBundle.java:255)
     [java]     at
org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseClassLoader.findLocalClass(EclipseClassLoader.java:116)
     [java] Class not found "org.eclipse.emf.test.performance.AllSuites"
     [java]     at
org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.BundleLoader.findLocalClass(BundleLoader.java:337)
...

In M3, org.eclipse.osgi_3.2.0.jar was renamed to org.eclipse.osgi_3.2.0.v20051030.jar, so I had to make the plugin renamer (buildProductUpdateJars.xml:43) more generic:

OLD:
       <move todir="${base.builder}/plugins">
	<fileset dir="${base.builder}/plugins"><include name="**/org.eclipse.osgi*.jar"/></fileset>
    	<mapper type="regexp" from="org.eclipse.osgi_([\d\.])+\.jar" to="org.eclipse.osgi.jar"/>
      </move>

       <move todir="${base.builder}/plugins">
	<fileset dir="${base.builder}/plugins"><include name="**/org.eclipse.osgi*.jar"/></fileset>
    	<mapper type="regexp" from="org.eclipse.osgi_.*\.jar" to="org.eclipse.osgi.jar"/>
       </move>

Whoops. Wrong bug. The comments about UM should not be here. ;-)

The actual problem appears to be that EMFTestPerformancePlugin is not a valid plugin/activator. Much of that plugin's code was commented out shortly after EMF 2.1.0 release, in order to try to make it run standalone, without Eclipse. As such, it no longer runs in Eclipse.

traces.message: The activator org.eclipse.emf.test.performance.EMFTestPerformancePlugin for bundle org.eclipse.emf.test.performance is invalid      [java]
